reviews.review_msg: Personally, I think Dr. Jackson's courses are good. I took Earth Dynamic and Earth History with him, all getting A.  he clarifies what is going to be on the exam and he is an easy marker. Nice person too
Would probably take again

This class has interesting content but the content on the exams is pure memorization! Every tiny detail on the lecture slides- even things she mumbles in the back will be on the exam. First test, 45% of the class failed. The content on the exams are so pick and choose as well, you could study everything and she'll choose the least useful content.

Textbook was good to have but the reading was recommended and not tested. There were a lot of assignments but they weren't too strenuous. The testing style was not a good fit for me. 50 minutes for a 50-60 mark exam, so I was in a blind panic. You really have to know the material to pass. Lecture was informative and I learned some solid stuff.
110% helpful and friendly. No matter what, she'll do her absolute best to make sure you pass. I've never known a teacher who genuinely cares about her students as much. Don't let her down :)

Most amazing and dedicated teacher I've met. Willing to do anything and everything to make sure her students learn, and not just for the course. She's incredibly nice and genuine, and if you actually give a crap about your studies (compared to wanting easy credits or wanting to pass), she will be one of the best teachers you ever have.

She tries to cover stuff that's way too much to handle in one whole semester. Unless you take three courses, it's pretty challenging to understand and memorize a whole bunch of information. She's not a mean person or anything, but her tests were bizarre, the class average for midterm 1 was 51% and the second one was 59%.
horrible prof, very hard, tests are very hard, i wish i never took this course

You have to give credit where credit it due. She remarked an entire midterm for 100+ students just to help improve the marks. Most lazy profs could care less. She is highly knowledgeable and full of energy. While the exams are pretty tough even with a cheat sheet, they are a fair assessment of your work ethic in this course.
TERRIBLE TEACHER! Her notes and recommendation for studying for her quizzes is TERRIBLE! AND SHES BORING!

SHE thinks that this class is a GPA booster. Ridiculously hard so called 'quizzes'. Who gives a 'quiz' out of 69 worth 30%?! And did I mention it was 7 pages of written questions to be completed in 50 min! Even though we are allowed a cheatsheet, she does not know how to write tests.
Studying for the exam gave me suicidal thoughts. Very hard to get an A. Avoid this class at any cost.
The assignment is easy but the exams are extremely hard. The content is too much and too much stuff need to be  memorized.

This prof is pretty good. If you have an interest in the class to start with you're set. Go to class and he will tell you whats in the exam.  Biweekly quizzes straight out of the text, and in order too.  I got a 67 on the midterm, went and spoke to him, he explained my mistakes and how to get full marks, ended up with an A in the class. Really good

Prof is very mono-tone. Assignments are really really easy because they come straight from the textbook. Midterms are easy because he hints what questions will be on the midterm and what to study. lectures are really boring and textbook is useless for midterms and exams. Overall ALOT of memorization. Easy course if u study and memorize.

Lectures are extremely boring and you can get by without attending them. Lecture slides are posted prior to the class. Midterm and final are fair but long answers are out of 30 and it is almost impossible to get full marks. Final wasn't cumulative and no written assignments were assigned.

Lectures are very boring. Materials are straight out from the textbook, which mean you can study yourself without attending lecture. Tests are hard as questions are all written; hard to guess what he wants.

The prof is very boring to listen to in lecture; however he does send out lecture notes beforehand. His online quizzes are TOO easy b/c everything is word-for-word out of the txtbook. His exams are purely essay questions and you really have to know and understand everything to do good. It is just a lot of memorization.

Lecs & textbook were no doubt boring. Assignments were a little hard to get perfect on as he wanted specific details. But you get the hang of it. I pulled a B on the MT w/ one day of studying. I didn't attend all lecs but he does tell us what he expects us to know. Know what to study and what not to study.Prof very approachable. Ended up w/ an A.

I'll agree with the other comments but that class was not really THAT bad! It is challenging with lots of memorizing to do but he hints what to know and what to ignore during lectures for the exams. Content wise, it's very informative but lecs were boring still! Exams are easy cause you get to choose  1/2 the questions to answer ! Class Recomended

His lectures/slides are basically condensed versions of the text, so it's not really necessary to go to lectures. But you should, since he often gives helpful tips. Assignments/reading/tests are all killer. Not a GPA raiser, not for slackers. He's actually very helpful and easy going if you go talk to him though.

I am a Business student and so i took this class because i thought it would be an easy elective. it wasnt an easy class! i barely pulled off an A-, and the lectures were boring. its not the professor's fault, the subject of study is just boring. it is an interesting class and i must say, Dirk is a very easy going person. DONT SLACK in his class!

This class was absolutely brutal. I couldn't stay awake at all. Way too much to remember for the final. The professor was also pretty boring, almost seemed like he didn't really want to teach a first year class. I'm still amazed that I pulled off a B... I felt like I was going to fail after that final. Not recommended.

An extremely boring class. He has no intonation in his voice or any means to keep anyone awake. I attended all lectures and the final was based purely on his posted notes (online). The weekly assignments were marked very stingy at a very high level, so it was imposable to score high. Not recommended to anyone who is lazy.

Lectures are particularly awful and the weekly assignments are brutal. I have never had so much trouble trying to stay awake for a class. I have never walked out of a lecture actually and remembered anything the prof has said. Complete waste of time.

OMG, assignment marking too harsh! don't take this course w/him. He is not clear. Weekly assignment is like weekly essay writing! and he expects us to answer like an PhD student!! This is 100 level course and should be fun, but so boring lecture that you can't hardly awake. Good luck whoever take this course.
VERY BORING...if you go to class, good luck trying to stay awake. The exam marking isn't too bad so memorize the textbook well and his class will reward you.

HE really enjoys what he does and helpful to students but assignment are long and painful with strict marking. Midterm and Final is fair but you need to study well. Not recommend to lazy students. Not GPA booster

Definitly a helpful one on one profesor. He is willing to spend time with you regarding midterms and assignments. Lecture is dull and slides are copied directly from the text. So even the most keen students will end up skipping lecture in exchange for a very heavy bit of reading and assignments. Interesting material, but prepare to enjoy your text.

Definitly a helpful one on one profesor. He is willing to spend time with you regarding midterms and assignments. The biggest problem with this course is the dull and monotone delivery in lecture, and the fact that lecture is copied directly from the text. So even the most keen students will end up skipping lecture in exchange for a very heavy bit

Kirste is a good prof, he cares about his students and explains the concepts well. When studying for the midterm and final memorize the powerpoints and lecture notes. The assignments, while straight out of the text, were time consuming and marked very stringently. Overall, I'd recommend this class, but be prepared to work for your grade.

Lectures were COMPLETELY useless and very painful to listen to - he just regurgitates the material in the book in his monotone voice, nothing to gain here.    Homework is plentiful and marked way too hard. Midterm and final are fair and doable if you study.  Overall, this course was a huge pain and incredibly useless - def. not a gpa booster.

Great prof. Very interested and passionate and very very well-read on his subject matter. Presents everything in a light manner and always has a little goofy smile on his face; you can tell he really enjoys what he does.
